It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange, often attracting specific pollinators such as moths and bees. The plant has a compact, succulent-like growth habit, with thick, fleshy leaves adapted to store water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Panmorphia grayumii is considered a vulnerable species.
